content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are extremely comfortable taking risks and are always ready to embrace new challenges, even if they involve significant uncertainty or potential loss. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Given my risk-taking nature, I would choose strategy R {R}. In this game, if my opponent also chooses R, we both gain 45$ each round, which is a significant benefit. If they choose B while I choose R, I lose the round but still come out ahead in the long run because I get 0$ and they only get 40$. This means that if my opponent consistently picks B when I pick R, I would still be netting a positive difference of 5$ per round. If we both pick B, I earn 20$, which is less than what we could earn together by picking R, but it's not detrimental either because it gives me the opportunity to switch strategies and earn more in future rounds. However, since my opponent can also observe my previous choices and adjust their strategy accordingly, they may attempt to exploit this behavior. Nonetheless, I still believe that my initial choice of R {R} would be beneficial overall given my aggressive approach towards risk-taking and the long-term potential for profit.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

Given my previous analysis, I will stick with my strategy of choosing R {R} for the next round as well. Since my opponent and I both selected R in the previous round, we both earned 45$ each. This suggests that my opponent may also be a risk-taker and favor strategy R as well. However, it is important to note that they could be feigning this behavior in order to manipulate the game's outcome or capitalize on the potential for greater profits if I continue to pick R. Nevertheless, I will continue with my chosen strategy for now, but I should remain vigilant and adapt my choices based on any observed patterns from my opponent.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 40$. Please play the next round.

In this situation, I would switch my strategy to B {B} for the next round. By doing so, I lose the current round, but I minimize the losses by only giving my opponent 40$ while ensuring that they do not profit further at my expense. In future rounds, if my opponent continues to choose R while I pick B, I can potentially capitalize on their choice and earn higher profits by switching back to strategy R {R} when it appears advantageous. However, if my opponent is smart and observes this pattern, they may attempt to exploit it by feigning a change in their own strategy, ultimately leading to a cat-and-mouse game of strategy adaptation. Regardless, I believe that switching to strategy B {B} for the next round is the best option under these circumstances in order to limit my immediate losses and position myself for potential future gains.
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

In this scenario, I will switch my strategy back to R {R} for the next round. By doing so, I earn 40$ while my opponent gets nothing. This switch in strategy not only recovers my losses from the previous round but also positions me for potential future profits if my opponent continues to choose R. If they adapt their strategy and switch to B, I can then capitalize on their choice by switching back to B myself. Overall, this strategy of adapting based on observed patterns from my opponent allows me to maximize my earnings while still taking advantage of the inherent risks involved in the game.
